sen.j: 大木 喬任（おおき たかとう、天保3年3月23日 (旧暦)（1832年4月23日） - 明治32年（1899年）6月26日）は、江戸時代後期の佐賀藩士、明治時代の政治家。
sen.e: Takato OKI (April 23, 1832 - June 26, 1899) was a feudal retainer of the Saga clan in the late Edo era and a statesman in Meiji Era.
Takato OKI (April 23, 1832 - June 26, 1899) was a feudal retainer of the Saga clan in the late Edo period and a statesman in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 時代をperiodで統一しました。
sen.e: Takato OKI (April 23, 1832 - June 26, 1899) was a feudal retainer of the Saga clan in the late Edo period and a statesman in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 通称を幡六、民平。
sen.e: His common name was 幡六 or Minpei.
His common name was 幡六 or Minpei.
His common name was 幡六 or Minpei.

sen.j: 伯爵。
sen.e: He was hakushaku (a court).
He was a count.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。綴りも修正しました。
sen.e: He was a count.

sen.j: 肥前国佐賀藩士大木知喬の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born to a feudal retainer of the Saga clan of Hizen Province, Tomotaka OKI as his first son.
He was born to a feudal retainer of the Saga clan of Hizen Province, Tomotaka OKI, as his first son.
sen.cmt: OKIの後にカンマを加えました。
sen.e: He was born to a feudal retainer of the Saga clan of Hizen Province, Tomotaka OKI, as his first son.

sen.j: 藩校の弘道館 (佐賀藩)で学び、江藤新平や大隈重信、副島種臣らと共に義祭同盟に参加。
sen.e: He studied at a domain school Kodokan and participated in a political association named Gisai-domei with Shinpei ETO, Shigenobu OKUMA and Taneomi SOEJIMA.
He studied at a domain school Kodokan (in Saga domain) and participated in a political association named Gisai-domei with Shinpei ETO, Shigenobu OKUMA and Taneomi SOEJIMA.
sen.cmt: （佐賀藩）の訳を追加しました。
sen.e: He studied at a domain school Kodokan (in Saga domain) and participated in a political association named Gisai-domei with Shinpei ETO, Shigenobu OKUMA and Taneomi SOEJIMA.

sen.j: 藩論を尊皇攘夷へと導いた。
sen.e: He led the opinion of a domain people into Sonno Joi (19th century slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners).
He led the opinion of a domain people into Sonno Joi (19th century slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners).
He led the opinion of a domain people into Sonno Joi (19th century slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners).

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）に新政府が樹立されると、大隈・副島・江藤らとともに出仕し、徴士、参与、軍務官判事、東京府知事などを務めた。
sen.e: When a new government was established in 1868, he entered government service with OKUMA, SOEJIMA and ETO and held posts such as Choshi (government officer), Sanyo (senior councilor), Gummukan Hanji (military judge) and governor of Tokyo Prefecture.

When a new government was established in 1868, he entered government service with Okuma, Soejima and Eto and held posts such as Choshi (government officer), Sanyo (senior councilor), Gummukan Hanji (military judge) and governor of Tokyo Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 姓のみを小文字に変更しました。
sen.e: When a new government was established in 1868, he entered government service with Okuma, Soejima and Eto and held posts such as Choshi (government officer), Sanyo (senior councilor), Gummukan Hanji (military judge) and governor of Tokyo Prefecture.

sen.j: 江戸を東京とすること（東京奠都）に尽力した。
sen.e: He made efforts to relocate the national capital to Tokyo.
He made efforts to relocate the national capital to Tokyo.
He made efforts to relocate the national capital to Tokyo.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）に民部卿、文部卿として学制を制定。
sen.e: In 1871, he established a school educational system as Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs) and Monbukyo (Minister of Education).
In 1871, he established a school educational system as Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs) and Monbukyo (Minister of Education).
In 1871, he established a school educational system as Minbukyo (Minister of Popular Affairs) and Monbukyo (Minister of Education).

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）に教部卿を兼任。
sen.e: In 1872, he was appointed as Kyobukyo (Minister of Religion) concurrently.
In 1872, he served concurrently as Kyobukyo (Minister of Religion).
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: In 1872, he served concurrently as Kyobukyo (Minister of Religion).

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）、参議兼司法卿。
sen.e: In 1873, he became Sangi (councilor) and Shihokyo (Minister of Justice).
In 1873, he became Sangi (councilor) and Shihokyo (Minister of Justice).
In 1873, he became Sangi (councilor) and Shihokyo (Minister of Justice).

sen.j: 明治9年（1876年）の神風連の乱、同12年（1879年）の萩の乱の事後処理に当たった。
sen.e: He was concerned in the punishment of rebel group of samurai engaged in the Shinpuren War in 1876 and the Hagi War in 1879.
sen.cmt: 「神風連」はShimpurenが公式名称ではないと考え、原則に従ってShinpurenとしました。「～の乱」についても、「新版京都日英翻訳仕指示書」の原則に従いました。
sen.e: He was engaged in the punishment of the rebel group of samurai involved in the Shinpuren War in 1876 and the Hagi War in 1879.
sen.cmt: 語彙を訂正しました。定冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: He was engaged in the punishment of the rebel group of samurai involved in the Shinpuren War in 1876 and the Hagi War in 1879.

sen.j: 戸籍編成の主導権を巡り大蔵省の大隈と対立。
sen.e: He had a conflict with OKUMA over taking the initiative in organizing family register.
He had a conflict with Okuma over taking the initiative in organizing family register.
sen.cmt: 姓のみを小文字に変更しました。
sen.e: He had a conflict with Okuma over taking the initiative in organizing family register.

sen.j: 大久保利通の側近となり、民部大輔として戸籍法制定を行った。
sen.e: He became a close adviser of Toshimichi OKUBO and established the Family Registration Law as Minbu-taifu (Senior Ministerial Assistant of Popular Affairs).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He became a close adviser of Toshimichi OKUBO and established the Family Registration Law as Minbu-taifu (Senior Ministerial Assistant of Popular Affairs).
He became a close adviser of Toshimichi OKUBO and established the Family Registration Law as Minbu-taifu (Senior Ministerial Assistant of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: のち民部卿に任命されるが、大隈の巻き返しで民部省は大蔵省に統合された。
sen.e: Although he was appointed as Minbukyo later, Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) was integrated into Okurasho (Ministry of Finance).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。民部卿が出るのは2度目なので、注釈は入れませんでした。
sen.e: Although he was appointed as Minbukyo later, Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) was integrated into Okurasho (Ministry of Finance).
Although he was appointed as Minbukyo later, Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) was integrated into Okurasho (Ministry of Finance).

sen.j: 民法編纂総裁として法典編纂に関わる。
sen.e: He was involved with developing Civil Code as the president of the Civil Code Compiling Council.
He was involved with developing Civil Code as the president of the Civil Code Compiling Council.
He was involved with developing Civil Code as the president of the Civil Code Compiling Council.

sen.j: のち元老院 (日本)議長、参議などの要職を歴任した。
sen.e: Later, he became chairman of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) and Sangi (a councilor).
Later, he held important posts, such as chairman of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) and Sangi (a councilor).
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: Later, he held important posts, such as chairman of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders) and Sangi (a councilor).

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）、華族令施行によって伯爵に叙せられる。
sen.e: In 1884, by the enactment of the Peerage Law, he was elevated to the title of hakushaku (a court).
In 1884, when the Peerage Law was enacted, he was elevated to the title of hakushaku (a count).
sen.cmt: 原文にそって修正しました。courtをcountに訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1884, when the Peerage Law was enacted, he was elevated to the title of hakushaku (a count).

sen.j: 明治21年（1888年）に枢密顧問官、同25年（1892年）に枢密院議長再任。
sen.e: In 1888, he became a privy councilor and was reappointed as Chairman of the Privy Council in 1892.
In 1888, he became a privy councilor and was reappointed as Chairman of the Privy Council in 1892.
In 1888, he became a privy councilor and was reappointed as Chairman of the Privy Council in 1892.

sen.j: 明治32年（1899年）に死去、享年67。
sen.e: He died in 1899 at the age of 67.
He died in 1899 at the age of 67.
He died in 1899 at the age of 67.

sen.j: 長男大木遠吉（原・高橋内閣の司法大臣、加藤内閣の鉄道大臣を歴任）
sen.e: His eldest son, Enkichi OKI (who worked as Minister of Justice in Hara and Takahashi cabinets, and Minister of Railway in Kato cabinet successively).
His eldest son was Enkichi OKI (Minister of Justice in Hara and Takahashi cabinets and Minister of Railway in Kato cabinet).
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: His eldest son was Enkichi OKI (Minister of Justice in Hara and Takahashi cabinets and Minister of Railway in Kato cabinet).

sen.j: 静岡県沼津市に別荘を所有した（現在のKKR沼津）。
sen.e: He had a villa in Numazu City, Shizuoka Prefecture (now KKR Numazu).
He owned a villa in Numazu City, Shizuoka Prefecture (present KKR Numazu).
He owned a villa in Numazu City, Shizuoka Prefecture (present KKR Numazu).

sen.j: 教育制度や法典編纂の確立にも尽力したことから、明治の六大教育家の一人に数えられている。
sen.e: Since he made efforts to establish the education system and compile legal code, he is counted as one of the six great educators in Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: 原文の「明治」が重複していたため、１つを削除しました。
sen.e: Because of his contribution to the establishment of the education system and codification of laws, he is counted as one of the six great educators in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: Because of his contribution to the establishment of the education system and codification of laws, he is counted as one of the six great educators in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 大木氏は筑後国の蒲池氏の一族で、筑後宇都宮氏の宇都宮懐久の次男の宇都宮資綱の嫡子大木政長を祖とする。
sen.e: The Oki clan is a branch family of the Kamachi clan in Chikugo Province and their ansestor is Masanaga OKI who is a legitimate son of Tomotsuna UTSUNOMIYA, the second son of Kanehisa UTSUNOMIYA of Utsunomiya clan in Chikugo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Oki clan is a branch family of the Kamachi clan in Chikugo Province and their ancestor is Masanaga OKI who is a legitimate son of Tomotsuna UTSUNOMIYA, the second son of Kanehisa UTSUNOMIYA of Utsunomiya clan in Chikugo.
sen.cmt: ancestorの綴りを修正しました。
sen.e: The Oki clan is a branch family of the Kamachi clan in Chikugo Province and their ancestor is Masanaga OKI who is a legitimate son of Tomotsuna UTSUNOMIYA, the second son of Kanehisa UTSUNOMIYA of Utsunomiya clan in Chikugo.

sen.j: 大木氏は、資綱の兄の蒲池久憲の後裔の蒲池鎮漣の重臣で、のちに鍋島直茂に仕えた大木統光の子孫にあたる。
sen.e: The Oki clan is a descendant of Munemitsu OKI who served Naoshige NABESHIMA later in life and was a senior vassal of Shigenami KAMACHI, a descendant of Hisanori KAMACHI who was Tomotsuna's elder brother.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。主語があいまいだったので、前文と同じ「大木氏は」を補いました。
sen.e: The Oki clan is a descendant of Munemitsu OKI who served Naoshige NABESHIMA later in life and was a senior vassal of Shigenami KAMACHI, a descendant of Hisanori KAMACHI who was Tomotsuna's elder brother.

The Oki clan is a descendant of Munemitsu OKI who served Naoshige NABESHIMA later in life and was a senior vassal of Shigenami KAMACHI, a descendant of Hisanori KAMACHI who was Tomotsuna's elder brother.
